>From: Derek James <djames@...>

>I'm having a bit of a hard time wrapping my head around what you're
>doing.  Is there any way you could post a couple of the compressed and
>target images in the photos section?

Done.  Photo album IEX has two images.  Ignore the thumbnails, look at the 
actual images.  The first image is a 9x9 input image, what is being input 
into the network.  The other is the target image, what the network wants to 
be able to reproduce.

Every activation returns ONE pixel.  Which pixel, and how big that pixel is 
is determined by the top,left,right,bottom inputs.  a top,left of 0,0 and 
bottom,right of 1,1 means return one pixel that corresponds to the average 
intensity of the whole target image.  With a bottom,right of 0.5,0.5 it 
means return the average intensity of the region that is the upper left 
quadrant of the target image.  Make sense?
